intro: Drimia nagarjunae, commonly known as the Nagarjunan bulbous plant, is a species native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family, characterized by its tuberous root system and grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
